description.summary: Profound psychological events experienced during clinical death or near-death states, characterized by common elements including tunnels, white light, deceased relatives, life review, and out-of-body sensations.
description.full: Near-Death Experiences (NDEs) are profound psychological events that occur during clinical death or close brushes with death. First systematically studied and named by Raymond Moody in 1975, NDEs are characterized by common elements across cultures: moving through a tunnel, encountering a brilliant white light, meeting deceased relatives or spiritual beings, experiencing a comprehensive life review, feeling profound peace and unconditional love, and having out-of-body experiences. Experiencers often report temporal distortion, ineffability (difficulty describing the experience), and profound life transformation following the event. Research by investigators including Pim van Lommel, Sam Parnia, and Bruce Greyson has documented thousands of cases. Theories range from spiritual explanations (evidence of afterlife/soul) to neurological explanations (DMT release, oxygen deprivation, temporal lobe stimulation, REM intrusion). Scientific studies like the AWARE study and van Lommel's Dutch study have attempted to investigate NDEs rigorously. Cultural interpretations vary, with religious and spiritual frameworks shaping how the experience is understood. NDEs are related to out-of-body experiences and remain a subject of intense scientific and philosophical interest in consciousness studies.

etymology.meaning: Experience occurring near the point of death

related_phenomena.name: Out-of-Body Experiences
related_phenomena.description: OBEs are common component of NDEs

related_phenomena.name: Consciousness Studies
related_phenomena.description: Academic study of consciousness and altered states

common_elements.description: Moving through a dark tunnel or void toward light
Brilliant, warm, loving white or golden light
Encounters with deceased loved ones or spiritual beings
Panoramic review of one's entire life
Viewing one's body and surroundings from outside
Overwhelming sense of peace, love, and acceptance
Point of no return that experiencer cannot or chooses not to cross
Decision or compulsion to return to physical life

characteristics.description: Time seems slowed, stopped, or meaningless
Life-changing effects on beliefs, values, and behavior
Experiencers report reduced or eliminated death anxiety

context.duration: Seconds to minutes (physical time); timeless (experienced time)

range.description: Universal human phenomenon reported across all cultures

demographics.cultural_distribution: All cultures report similar core elements
demographics.prevalence: Estimated 4-15% of people who survive cardiac arrest report NDEs

first_recorded.source: Historical texts and religious accounts across cultures

peak_activity_periods.description: Modern scientific study era following Moody's work

origins.cultural_roots: Universal human experience documented across cultures and time periods
origins.earliest_accounts: Ancient religious texts, Plato's Republic (Er's account), medieval visions
origins.folklore_connections: Connected to religious visions, afterlife beliefs, soul journey narratives

timeline.significance: NDEs documented in ancient texts including Plato, Tibetan Book of the Dead, religious visions
Swiss geologist documents accounts from climbers' near-death falls
Publication of 'Life After Life' systematizes study and popularizes phenomenon
International Association for Near-Death Studies established
Prospective study of cardiac arrest patients published in The Lancet
Sam Parnia's large-scale study of cardiac arrest and awareness
Continued scientific investigation by Greyson, Parnia, and others

history.modern_era: NDEs are studied using rigorous scientific methodology. Research focuses on prospective studies of cardiac arrest patients, neurological correlates, and consistency of reports across cultures.

key_studies.findings: Documented awareness during cardiac arrest; ongoing research

documented_cases.description: Thousands of documented accounts across cultures and time periods
documented_cases.consistency: High degree of consistency in core elements across cultures

veridical_perception.description: Cases where experiencers report accurate details from out-of-body perspective

spiritual.name: Afterlife Evidence
spiritual.description: NDEs provide evidence of soul/consciousness surviving death

spiritual.name: Soul Journey
spiritual.description: Experience represents actual journey of soul/consciousness

neurological.name: DMT Release
neurological.description: Brain releases DMT (dimethyltryptamine) at death, creating experience

neurological.name: Oxygen Deprivation (Hypoxia)
neurological.description: Lack of oxygen to brain creates hallucinations

neurological.name: Temporal Lobe Stimulation
neurological.description: Electrical activity in temporal lobe creates experience

neurological.name: REM Intrusion
neurological.description: REM sleep state intrudes into waking consciousness during crisis

psychological.name: Dissociation/Coping Mechanism

religious_interpretations.hinduism: Atman journey, karma review, yamadutas (death messengers)
